params._amount0Max: the maximum amount of token0 msg.sender willing to input
params._amount0Min: the minimum amount of token0 actually input (slippage protection)
params._amount1Max: the maximum amount of token1 msg.sender willing to input
params._amount1Min: the minimum amount of token1 actually input (slippage protection)
params._pool: address of G-UNI pool to add liquidity to
params._receiver: account to receive minted G-UNI tokens

returns.amount0: amount of token0 transferred from msg.sender to mint `mintAmount`
returns.amount1: amount of token1 transferred from msg.sender to mint `mintAmount`
returns.mintAmount: amount of G-UNI tokens minted and transferred to `receiver`

rebalanceAndAddLiquidity(address,uint256.details: note on swaps: MUST swap to/from token0 from/to token1 as specified by zeroForOne will revert on "overshot" swap (receive more outToken from swap than can be deposited) swapping for erroneous tokens will not necessarily revert in all cases and could result in loss of funds so be careful with swapActions and swapDatas params.

params._amount0In: the amount of token0 msg.sender forwards to router
params._amount0Min: the minimum amount of token0 actually deposited (slippage protection)
params._amount1In: the amount of token1 msg.sender forwards to router
params._amount1Min: the minimum amount of token1 actually deposited (slippage protection)
params._pool: address of G-UNI pool to add liquidity to
params._receiver: account to receive minted G-UNI tokens

returns.amount0: amount of token0 actually deposited into pool
returns.amount1: amount of token1 actually deposited into pool
returns.mintAmount: amount of G-UNI tokens minted and transferred to `receiver`

rebalanceAndAddLiquidityETH(address,uint.details: note on swaps: MUST swap either ETH -> token or token->WETH swaps which try to execute token -> ETH instead of WETH will revert

params._amount0Min: Minimum amount of token0 received after burn (slippage protection)
params._amount1Min: Minimum amount of token1 received after burn (slippage protection)
params._burnAmount: The number of G-UNI tokens to burn
params._pool: address of G-UNI pool to remove liquidity from
params._receiver: The account to receive the underlying amounts of token0 and token1

returns.amount0: actual amount of token0 transferred to receiver for burning `burnAmount`
returns.amount1: actual amount of token1 transferred to receiver for burning `burnAmount`
returns.liquidityBurned: amount of liquidity removed from the underlying Uniswap V3 position

addLiquidity(address,uint256,uint256,uin.notice: addLiquidity adds liquidity to G-UNI pool of interest (mints G-UNI LP tokens)

addLiquidityETH(address,uint256,uint256,.notice: addLiquidityETH same as addLiquidity but expects ETH transfers (instead of WETH)

rebalanceAndAddLiquidity(address,uint256.notice: rebalanceAndAddLiquidity accomplishes same task as addLiquidity/addLiquidityETH but we rebalance msg.sender's holdings (perform a swap) before adding liquidity.

rebalanceAndAddLiquidityETH(address,uint.notice: rebalanceAndAddLiquidityETH same as rebalanceAndAddLiquidity except this function expects ETH transfer (instead of WETH)

removeLiquidity(address,uint256,uint256,.notice: removeLiquidity removes liquidity from a G-UNI pool and burns G-UNI LP tokens

removeLiquidityETH(address,uint256,uint2.notice: removeLiquidityETH same as removeLiquidity except this function unwraps WETH and sends ETH to receiver account
